bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 21 (Monday, February 9, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LONG:H.R. 815.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 1: The Congress shall havePower to lay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts and Excises,to pay the Debts and provide for the common Defence andgeneral Welfare of the United States; but all Duties, Impostsand Excises shall be uniform throughout the United States.Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18 of the Constitution, whichstates ``To make all Laws which shall be necessary and properin the Government of the United States or in any Departmentor Officer thereof.''[Page H866]

item.title: Access to Independent Health Insurance Advisors Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.fullName: Resident Commissioner Pierluisi, Pedro R. [D-PR-At Large]

summary.text:
Access to Professional Health Insurance Advisors Act of 2015

Amends the Public Health Service Act to exclude remuneration paid for licensed independent insurance producers from administrative costs for purposes of calculating the medical-loss ratio of a health insurance plan.

Defines "independent insurance producer" to mean an insurance agent or broker, insurance consultant, benefit specialist, limited insurance representative, and any other person required to be licensed under state law to sell, solicit, negotiate, service, effect, procure, renew, or bind policies of insurance coverage or offer advice, counsel, opinions, or services related to insurance.

bill.title: Access to Professional Health Insurance Advisors Act of 2015

item.title: Access to Professional Health Insurance Advisors Act of 2015
To amend title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act to preserve consumer and employer access to licensed independent insurance producers.
Access to Professional Health Insurance Advisors Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
